Description: Limestone ostracon: with faint traces of two sections of text, comprising remains of six vertical registers of black-painted hieroglyphs and eleven vertical registers respectively, with very faint traces of a black-painted vignette, representing funerary deities, in between. The subject is the journey of Ra through the hours of the Day or Night.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tomb of Ramses VII, TT1
Curator's comments: Being studied by J. F. Quack (Heidelberg).
29509 and 29510 appear to join directly (suggested by J. F. Quack).
Bibliographic references: Birch 1868 / Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum (V)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389922) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389922)
Condition: fair (two fragments joined - text very faded)
Acquisition notes: One of three from the 1836 Burton sale lot 233.
